heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 13 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.6°C), outside temperature (down 1.9°C), and inside temperature (down 1.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 153 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 2.9°C), cloud levels (up 336 m), and inside temperature (up 2.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 152.7m higher than yesterday, 60.7m lower than the past week, 335.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 926m and a peak of 1357m, averaging 1237.8m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, occasional overcast conditions, and the light is absent. Stable weather patterns due to high pressure.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
